name: Cool Muhlenberg Library. Renovate HVAC System

name: Parks Greening
description: Install new and improve existing plantings ' trees, shrubs, flowers and grass - around perimeters and entrances of John Jay Park.

name: Lexington Houses Security Upgrade
description: Purchase and install layered security system to ensure residents' safety in light of growing issues and incidents and the rise in neighborhood homeless population, which has caused security problems.

name: P.S. 290 Bathrooms

name: Renovate Auditorium for Eleanor Roosevelt H.S.
description: Extend stage and replace seating and flooring to improve view, increase capacity, and support gym activities. Replace antiquated control board, install acoustical panels and simplify lighting system.

name: Rooftop Greenhouse at P.S. 290

name: Sound System at Julia Richman JREC Auditorium
description: This project will address the acoustical needs of the auditorium and update the sound system to correct the reverberation and an inability to hear and understand speakers.

name: STEM Green Roof for P.S./I.S. 217
description: Finalize funding to build a STEM Green Roof atop P.S. /I.S. 217. Transform 6,750 square feet of unused P.S./I.S. 217 school roof into an outdoor learning hub for science, math, nutrition and the arts.

name: 67th Street Library HVAC Improvements
description: Replacement or upgrade of the boiler to provide adequate heat.

name: Webster Library HVAC Improvements
description: Upgrade or replacement of air-conditioning system. This library is a designated NYC cooling center.

name: UWS CERT Emergency Response and Education Vehicle
description: Purchase of a vehicle for UWS Community Emergency Response Team to store emergency and educational materials, and create pop-up preparedness events at street fairs, schools, and community gatherings.'

description: This project will fund wiring to install air conditioning systems in common areas like cafeterias and auditoriums. Large sections of these schools cannot be used comfortably during spring and summer.

name: Power Up
description: Providing new computers for three schools that have outdated desktops and not enough laptops to service the students. Having new computers will educate and enhance the student's abilities.

name: Proper Pupil Potties
description: The complete renovation of select bathrooms at three public schools which are a persistent problem. This will reduce the amount of time and money used to maintain the aging bathrooms.

name: Outdoor Reading Room
description: Utilize outdoor space for a reading room and renovate the meeting room in the library. This would add reading space in a natural environment that will encourage returning visits and customer usage.

name: Basketball Court Renovations at Little Bush Park
description: Renovate the basketball courts for better usage and safety! This includes new backboards, basketball hoops, a sports coating and a new fence to enclose it.

name: Children's Swing Area Renovation
description: Renovating the children's swing area to make it a safer environment. The children's swing sets need new metal bars, a new safety surface installation and fencing repairs.

name: Playground Beautification at Little Bush Park
description: Horticultural renovations to beautify the playground and create a noise barrier between the playground and residential homes.

name: Air Conditioning Renovation at I.S. 73
description: Purchase and install an air conditioning system to cool the auditorium in the school building.

name: Auditorium Seat Replacement
description: Create a safer experience for students by replacing and repairing the auditorium seats in our schools.

name: Laptop Carts for Classrooms
description: Providing laptop carts for schools to make the latest technology more accessible for students in the classroom!

name: Operation Restroom Renovation
description: Working and updating bathrooms are essential for the health and hygiene of the students. These renovations are to bathrooms which require and have not received recent repairs or renovations.

name: Smart Boards for Schools
description: Fifteen SMART Boards for each of the listed schools will allow for the integration of various technologies within the classroom to improve the learning experiences of students!

name: Computers, Equipment and Furniture
description: Fulfilling a community need by adding more desktop computers along with equipment and furniture to the Ridgewood and Maspeth Public Libraries.

name: Train Countdown Clocks
description: The Rockaway train stations should have countdown clocks so residents can know when the train and the bus coming.

name: Auditorium Upgrade in P.S. 183Q
description: The auditorium is in need of stage curtains, a new projector screen, new speaks on stage and new fans to keep the auditorium cool.

name: Classroom Upgrade in P.S. 183Q
description: The classrooms are in need of electrical outlets and approximately 35 smart boards in each of the classrooms to help our students further their educations.

name: Designing a Track in the School Yard
description: P.S.106 is in need of a track in the school yard. A track in the school yard would not only help beautify the school but also provide an activity that would promote an healthy lifestyle for the students.

name: Far Rockaway High School Library Upgrade
description: The Far Rockaway High School library is very important to the school. It has resources that the students can rely on. But now the library is need of new computers and also an electrical upgrade.

name: Gymnasium Upgrade in P.S. 183Q
description: The gymnasium is in need of basketball hoops for our kids. The gym is also in need of bleachers so the school can invite parents and the community to school activities.

name: Locker Room Renovations
description: Far Rockaway Educational Campus is made up of other schools and is in need of a better locker room. It reminds people of a dungeon. The lighting is terrible and can be dangerous

name: M.S 53 Technology Upgrades
description: Needs new smart boards, computers and better electricity and wiring to utilize multiple devices.

name: M.S.53 Technology Upgrade
description: The school is in need of 6 new smart boards to further education for students.

name: New Smart Boards
description: P.S. 253 is in need of six new smart boards to further education for students

name: New Weight Room
description: The Far Rockaway High School weight room needs new equipment so students do not get injured; it also needs new lockers.

name: P.S.106 Technology Upgrade
description: The school is in need of 6 new smart boards to further the education for students.

name: Security Cameras
description: P.S 106 is a building that's isolated from other properties, a camera surveillance system would help ensure the safety of the school community

name: Rockaway Institute for a Sustainable Environment
description: The project with fit out RISE, new community center for local exhibits, film screenings, lectures, public events and youth programs, with furniture and equipment.

name: Median Repair on Rockaway Beach Boulevard
description: Repair center medians along Rockaway Beach Boulevard between Beach 102-105 Streets

name: Badminton Courts along Shore Front Parkway
description: Installation of badminton courts for badminton or Pickle ball along Shore Front Parkway in Rockaway Beach adjacent to new boardwalk

name: Bathroom Repair at Beach 106th St
description: Winterization/upgrades to bathrooms at Beach 106th Street Parks Department facility

name: Boardwalk Amenities
description: Boardwalk amenities including mile markers, storyboards, and information boards along Rockaway Boardwalk

name: Exercise Equipment along Shore Front Parkway
description: Adult exercise equipment installed along Shore Front Parkway adjacent to new boardwalk in Rockaway Beach

name: Rock Climbing Wall at Boardwalk
description: Rock climbing wall constructed in Rockaway Beach adjacent to new boardwalk

name: Upgrades to 17th Road Park
description: equipment upgrades and amenities to 17th Road Park in Broad Channel

name: Upgrades to All-American Park/Sunset Cove
description: Upgrades to All-American Park/Sunset Cove in Broad Channel

name: Upgrades to 5 Schools
description: P.S. 47 - Tech equipment ($45,000)  //  P.S. 317 - Tech equipment ($45,000)  //  P.S. 114 - Auditorium upgrades ($75,000)  //  Beach Channel Campus - mobile earth science lab cart RCHS ($60,000)  //  Beach Channel Campus - New exercise room with updated equipment ($150,000)  //  Scholar's Academy - Bathroom updates ($60,000)

name: Additional Turnstiles at York St. Subway (F Train)
description: Install additional turnstiles for York Street Station in 2017 which will reduce congestion and long lines for the 9,000 weekday riders now limited to only two turnstiles.

name: Pedestrian Safety Improvements - Meeker Avenue
description: Continuing safety improvements along this high-speed corridor to decrease crossing distances and improve pedestrian safety.

name: Real Time Arrival Signage for B44 Bus Route
description: Add signage that shows real-time, updated arrival times for up to 15 bus stops along Bedford and Nostrand Avenues.
location: Along B44 Bus Route in District 33

name: Safer Crossings for Hoyt Street at Gowanus Houses
description: Make street crossings safer between this housing development and the nearby subway. Add pedestrian safety enhancements to this four-block stretch of Hoyt Street that has no existing crossings.
location: Hoyt St., Butler St. to Degraw St., Gowanus

name: Street Safety Improvements near P.S.16
description: Install a curb extension at this much-used intersection between P.S. 16 and Independence Towers. Improve other street safety features between the housing development and the local school.
location: Corner of Bedford Ave. and Wilson St.,W'lliamsburg

name: Fix Taaffe Park: Community Seating Area
description: Create a moment of peace for area residents. Support a renovated seating area where all local residents can meet under the park's historic oak trees and plan their community's future; together.

name: Make Msgr. McGolrick Park Safer
description: This project focuses on repaving some of the sidewalks along the park and replacing fencing. Current sidewalks are cracked, unsafe for children, and hazardous for wheelchair and stroller access.

name: Safe to Play, Green Playground at M.S. 126
description: Transform a cement lot into a safe and colorful playground with interactive play structures. Additional funding through Trust for Public Land will make this a sustainable space for kids and community.

name: Hear the Beat! Community Sound Studio
description: This project will outfit an existing computer lab as a recording studio, so youth/adults could be trained for music/audio professions. Includes upgrades to the space and all needed audio equipment.

name: NYCHA Grounds Renovations Focused on Seating
description:
Gowanus & Wyckoff residents will help determine grounds improvements, to be installed at two NYCHA developments, resulting in more pleasant

areas for enjoying time outdoors and talking with friends.
location: Wyckoff Gardens and Gowanus Houses, Gowanus

name: Essential STEM Labs at I.S 318 and P.S 34
description: Let's bridge the technology gap and invest in the future for 2,000+ students at two amazing but underserved schools by funding essential STEM (Science, Tech, Engineering & Math) labs at both schools!

name: Finish the Upgrades with P.S. 261 Computer Carts
description: P.S. 261 is a K-5 school with 800 students. Their wiring was upgraded but to utilize the improvements the students need new computers; four new carts will give them what they need!

name: Let There Be Air! Juan Morel Campos School
description: Our school is used by D14, D75 and the community. We need AC in our auditorium. The auditorium gets used for many events such as performances, assemblies, and graduation and it is very hot!

name: Make Our School Cool! M.S. 126
description: Our building serves 3 schools and 1200 kids and needs wiring for AC in the classrooms and Auditorium! It's hard to concentrate and be good students when you're too hot! Give them a chance to succeed!

name: Sweating Should Be Fun! K293, Int'l Studies
description: The gym at this campus with 4 schools, PK-12 (with 1200 mostly Title I students) needs AC! The only large activity space in this growing school also hosts community programs and can get really hot!

name: Real Time Passenger Boards
description: Real Time Passenger Information in Council District 34. DOT will choose site locations with the City Council office post budget adoption.

name: Repaving our Bushwick Parks
description: Maria Hernandez Park and Fermi Playground can expect ground pavement, landscaping, and modern benches.

name: Grounds Renovation at Bushwick Houses
description: This grounds renovation will focus on installing fence around an existing garden located behind the community center. It will be designed to budget and may include installing walkways and seating.

name: Playground Upgrade at Williamsburg Houses
description: This playground will get new benches, play equipment, and a sprinkler system.

name: 21st Century Technology at P.S. 120 and P.S. 132
description: Includes smart boards, laptops, smart tables, a 3-D Printer, a green wall, and solar & weather panels.

name: A Cool Gym at P.S. 257
description: An air conditioner in the school gym, which is used throughout the school year and summer programming.

name: Auditorium Facelift at P.S. 147
description: Includes 300 new chairs, a new stage, and re-wiring for better sound equipment.

name: Technology Upgrades at P.S. 239 and P.S. 18
description: Includes two new laptop carts, two smart tables, a 3-D printers, six smart boards, and forty-two desktops.

name: Visual Arts Classroom Upgrade
description: This upgrade at MS 50/El Puente Community School calls for upgrades to lighting for accurate color work, ceiling tracks to hang 3-D art work, and new floors for an all around visual arts experience.

name: Electrify our Libraries in District 34
description: This proposal will provide four electric charging tables at each one of our libraries: Leonard Street, Bushwick Avenue and Dekalb Avenue. Residents will be able to work and re-charge from the same place.

name: Upgrade to Activity Rooms
description: This proposal will upgrade the activity room in the Leonard Street Library and will include collapsible tables, folding chairs, rugs, freshly painted walls and new book bins.

name: Upgrade to Activity Rooms in District 34
description: This proposal will include collapsible tables, folding chairs, rugs, freshly painted walls and new book bins for all three district libraries: Leonard Street, Bushwick Avenue and DeKalb Avenue.

name: Real-Time Information Signs: B65 & B44 Passengers
description:
Install real-time bus signs on two of the busiest lines in Brooklyn:



B65: Flatbush & Dean; Flatbush & Bergen; Bergen & New York; Dean & Nostrand



B44: New York & Eastern Pkwy; Nostrand & Eastern Pkwy

name: Bump Out at Washington Avenue and Dean Street
description: Create a bump-out at the Dean Street and Washington Avenue intersection. This is in response to increased vehicular traffic on Dean Street. It will help reduce the risk of pedestrian injuries.

name: Bus Pads on Fulton Street
description: Bus pads replace the surface where buses stop and replace the pavement that gets warped with a solid concrete pad. The warped streets cause danger for bikes, the old and the young who walk there.

name: President Street Bump-Outs
description: On President Street, create bump-outs to extend curbs into the street. This is a high-volume subway station with inadequate space for pedestrians. Project would decrease likelihood of injury/death.
location: President St. and Nostrand Ave. (2/5 Stop)

name: Security Cameras in Precincts 71 and 78
description: Install Argus security cameras at intersections where NYPD precincts have identified a need. Each Argus unit is a set of 2 cameras. Three units will be allocated to each of the 2 precincts.

name: Security Cameras in Precincts 88 and 77
description: Install Argus security cameras at intersections where NYPD precincts have identified a need. Each Argus unit is a set of 2 cameras. Three units will be allocated to each of the 2 precincts.

name: Basketball Court Renovation at Atlantic Terminal
description: Basketball court renovation

name: Basketball Court Renovation at Lafayette Gardens
description: Renovation of basketball court.

name: Basketball Court Renovation at Whitman Houses
description: Renovation of basketball court

name: Grounds Renovation
description: Project will be designed to budget in collaboration with the Resident Association leadership. Priorities to be considered will include lighting, trees, bushes, irrigation system and metal benches

name: Grounds Renovation
description: Project will be designed to budget in collaboration with the Resident Association leadership. Priorities to be considered will include lighting, trees, bushes, irrigation system and metal benches

name: Grounds Renovation
description: Project will be designed to budget in collaboration with the Resident Association leadership. Priorities to be considered will include lighting, trees, bushes, irrigation system and metal benches

name: HVAC System for the Willoughby Senior Center
description: HVAC system for the Willoughby Senior Center

name: Renovation of Farragut Community Center Entrance
description: Renovate the entry way to the Farragut community Center needs new walls, new paint and new floors.

name: Renovation to Willoughby Senior Center Entrance
description: Grounds Renovation for the outside. The entry way to the Willoughby Senior Center needs new walls, new paint and new floors.

name: Safety Upgrades in Farragut Housing Development
description: Design it to budget. Install Cameras in staircases and elevators.

name: Learning Walls for P.S. 20
description: Install pin-able writable walls in 20 classrooms for students and teachers to actively co-create learning. 5 temporary walls already increasing learning, initiation, critical thinking and cooperation.
location: PS 20 The Clinton Hill School 225 Adelphi Street

name: New Technology for High-Need Schools: PS 375 & 532
description: Creating a new computer lab at PS 375 and upgrading ancient AV technology in the auditorium at PS 532 will enable students at these two Title I schools to thrive in the 21st century.

name: Renovate Decrepit Bathrooms at PS 9 & PS 316
description: Update 6 badly deteriorated bathrooms; includes replacing broken toilets & installing hand dryers.

name: Goodbye to Sidewalk Cracks
description: Repair cracked sidewalks around the Armstrong NYCHA developments in D36. Quincy St b/w Marcy & Tompkins Aves.; Marcy b/w Gates to Quincy; Gates b/w Marcy and Tompkins

name: Pedestrian Safety at Marcy Ave. and Myrtle Ave.
description: Install neckdown at Marcy Avenue and Myrtle Avenue (In front of Marcy Houses and subway entrance).

name: A Top-Notch Dog Run for District 36
description: Transform the informal dog play area at Von King Park into a top notch dog run with separate vestibules and play areas for big and little dogs, new fencing, dog fountains and proper drainage.

name: Upgrade Brower Park Basketball Courts
description: Provide beautiful new surfaces for two of the four basketball courts in Brower Park, including new drainage, pavement and lines.

name: Upgrade Hattie Carthan Playground Handball Courts
description: Reconstruct wall (strip down to supports and re-cement); repave underfoot surface; install new benches and new fence; prune trees.

name: Security Cameras for Albany Houses
description: Add new security cameras to Albany Houses. (Project will be designed to budget and may not cover fully CCTV at both Albany I and II.)

name: Security Cameras for Marcy Houses Senior Buildings
description: Install security camera system to cover the two senior buildings (Marcy Avenue and Stockton Place) and other parts of Marcy Houses, as feasible. (Project will be designed to budget.)

name: 4 Science Carts for Bed-Stuy New Beginnings
description: Each Science Cart = $62,000

name: Dance Studio at P.S. 3
description: Transform a classroom into a dance studio w/ new floor, mirrors, barre & sound system.

name: New Laptops for P.S. 59
description: 2 laptop carts w/ 30-35 Lenovo laptops each

name: Smartboards for Smart Kids!
description: New smartboards for five D36 schools -- PS 289, PS 138, PS 93, PS 243 & Bedford Academy. $64K will fund 8 smartboards per school. Includes required electrical & data.
location: PS 289, PS 138, PS 93, PS 243 & Bedford Acdmy

name: Renovate and Upgrade Marcy Library Auditorium
description: Upgrade the multi-purpose room/ auditorium of the Marcy Branch of the Brooklyn Public Library with new electrical, lighting, flooring & shelving.

name: Community Board 6 Repair and Resurfacing
description: The streets are starting to wear out after years of improper care, resulting in dangerous cracks and potholes that cause accidents. White lanes have not been repainted, thus heightening the potential for accidents (for motorists and pedestrians) and irresponsible driving.

name: Electronic "Locator" Sign throughout the District
description: Install electronic bus signs along the B70, B63, B35, B11, B9, B57 & B61 bus routes. The signs will be posted at busy bus stops. The signs will tell riders the location and arrival time of their bus.

name: Brooklyn Community Board 7
description: The streets are starting to wear out after years of improper care, resulting in dangerous cracks and potholes that cause accidents. White lanes have not been repainted, thus heightening the potential for accidents (for motorists and pedestrians) and irresponsible driving.

name: Community Board 12 Street Repair and Resurfacing
description: The streets are starting to wear out after years of improper care, resulting in dangerous cracks and potholes that cause accidents. White lanes have not been repainted, thus heightening the potential for accidents (for motorists and pedestrians) and irresponsible driving.

name: Sunset Park Renovation
description: Repaving, installation of 20 new benches, replacement of existing dilapidated chain-link fences, and adding in picnic tables.

name: Basketball Court at 31 Centre Mall
description: Renovation to this basketball court will provide more recreational area for the Red Hook Community. It will include brand new basketball hoops and painted grounds.

name: Senior Center Yard Ground Beatifications
description: Renovation of the yard behind the new senior center which will include: picnic tables, chess tables, benches, a garden, barbecue grills, tables for other board games, & a non-smoking and alcohol area.

name: New Tree with Tree Guards
description: Beautify blocks across the district by planting new trees with tree guards in front of homes, businesses & parks.

name: Air Conditioning Wiring
description: This project will serve P.S. 1 in Sunset Park and M.S. 88 in Windsor Terrace for the installation of wiring that will support air conditioning units throughout the schools.

name: Auditorium Upgrade for M.S. 88 and M.S.136
description: These auditoriums are multi-purpose, handicapped-accessible community spaces. The spaces are currently outdated and need upgrades to better serve each school's internal and local community members.

name: Library Update
description: The project would involve the renovation of Middle School 88 and Sunset Park High School's library media center, currently equipped with highly outdated and non-functioning technology.
location: M.S. 88 and Sunset Park High School

name: Science Upgrade for MS.821 & IS.136
description: The labs in both schools rooms are outdated, thus not fully functional. Teachers are trying their best to work in the labs to effectively teach STEM topics. The upgrade will include 2 labs per school

name: South Brooklyn Community H.S.& P.S.169 Upgrades
description: There are no lockers, and thus students are required to carry their belongings, books, etc., throughout the day at SBHS. P.S.169 needs renovations of bathrooms that are in a state of disrepair.

name: Bus Clocks on B67/B69: Know When Bus Arrives!
description: Install bus countdown clocks that display real-time information about bus location at 12 B67/B69 stops. This will help mass transit users estimate wait times and make better travel decisions.

name: Curb Extension & Safer Crossing- Carroll Park
description: The installation of a curb extension at this very busy intersection would shorten the crossing distance and promote pedestrian safety for families and residents using Carroll Park.
location: Intersection of Carroll and Court Streets

name: Pedestrian Safety: Curb Ext. on Columbia St.
description: The installation of a curb extension at this very busy intersection would shorten the street crossing distance and increase pedestrian safety in this growing neighborhood.
location: Intersection of Union and Columbia Streets

name: Replace Cross-Hatch with Concrete on PPSW
description: Construct sidewalk on the southwest corner at Prospect Park Southwest and 16th Street, where there is only a painted cross-hatch, to improve pedestrian access to Prospect Park and nearby bus stops.

name: Brand New Dog Run: Areas for Big and Small Dogs
description: Many Kensington and Windsor Terrace dog owners do not have access to fenced-in space where their pups can exercise and socialize. Project is shared with Council Member Eugene & Borough President Adams

name: New 'Lake Mess Monster,' an Aquatic Weed Harvester
description: Prospect Park needs a new aquatic weed harvester (aka 'Lake Mess Monster') to remove scum from the lake. Without it, the scum will sink and proceed to rot, causing the water to become toxic.

name: Year-Round, Freeze-Resistant Drinking Fountains
description: The water fountains in Prospect Park are not available to use during the winter months. This upgrade would make 5 fountains along the Prospect Park Drive freeze-resistant and available year-round.
location: Prospect Park, 5 Locations along the Drive

name: PS 124 Dye Garden/Makerspace STEAM Enrichments
description: Create Dye Flower Garden and Makerspace for hands-on instruction in STEAM subjects. Dyes will be used in art & social studies projects; Makerspace will teach coding, modeling, 3D fabrication.

name: Retrofit 75 Auditorium Lights for Safety
description: School and after-school groups use auditorium daily. Current lights cast shadows, making steep floor unsafe, and use expensive short-life bulbs. New LED retrofit will fix safety and cost issues.

name: West Brooklyn Community HS Portable Laptop Lab
description: Three mobile carts with 25 laptops each will travel among classrooms to support instruction and foster IT skills. West Brooklyn Community HS is a transfer high school offering a second chance to high-needs students.

name: Mobile Studios" for Artists and Orgs in Gowanus
description: Three "mobile studios" - small, mobile workplaces - for artists and community organizations that will enliven underused areas and engage the public on local issues like displacement and resiliency.
location: Parks, Plazas, and Street-ends in Gowanus

name: Beautify Outdoor Space at Borough Park Library
description: Renovation of the library's outdoor area to include new plantings, new furnishings, and new pavement - to provide a much needed green space. Similar to new entrance at Midwood Library.

name: Create Teen Space at Carroll Gardens Library
description: Revamp the library's mezzanine-level to create more space and add comfortable furniture, outlets, and new lighting - to create an inviting space for teens to use after-school and on weekends
location: 396 Clinton St, between Union and Sackett Sts

name: Little Red Riding Hood Pre-K Sidewalk Extension
description: Sidewalk extensions at this corner paired with heavy-duty bollards
location: NE corner of Rogers Ave. and Lefferts Ave.

name: Montessori School Sidewalk Extension
description: Sidewalk extension on the South East corner matched by a painted curb extension with flexible post barriers
location: SE corner of Rogers Ave. and Rutland Rd.

name: P.S. 92 Sidewalk Extension
description: A concrete sidewalk extension, which could be matched by a painted curb extension with flexible post barriers on the North West corner.
location: SW corner of Rogers Ave. and Winthrop St.

name: Real-Time Passenger Information
description: Bus display signs that are visible from a distance and inform riders when their bus will arrive
location: Lincoln Rd Entrance; Church Ave. B35 Stop

name: Community Barbecue Sites in Prospect Park
description: New-style municipal grills, which are similar to those at Brooklyn Bridge Park Picnic Peninsula.
location: Lincoln Rd & E Drive; Parkside Ave & E Drive

name: Kensington Dog Run
description: An enclosed Dog Run at the Parade Grounds

name: Replacement of 'Lake Mess Monster'
description: A vessel that would grind up duck weed and other contaminants that cause visible pollution in the Prospect Park Lake.

name: Computer Lab Updates for Local Schools
description: General technology updates at P.S. 249, P.S. 245, P.S. 139, and P.S. 6

name: Gymnasium Upgrades at Erasmus High School
description: Physical upgrades to the gymnasium

name: Smartboards for P.S. 92
description: Twenty-nine smartboards are needed for PS 92.

name: Technology Updates for M.S. 2 Parkside Academy
description: Various technological updates at M.S. 2 Parkside Academy

name: Greenhouse Renovations at Murrow High School
description: Thousands of students use the greenhouse each year. This project would upgrade and improve the deteriorating greenhouse.

name: B16 Count Down Clock
description: Never miss your bus again! Electronic signs will be installed along B16 route to inform riders when the next bus is arriving.

name: Street Resurfacing
description: Repair and resurface roadways that have been identified as dangerous due to potholes, ridges and other holes.

name: Hauslter Truck for Community Board 14
description: The haulster is used for plowing and salt spreading in the winter and addressing illegal dumping and litter conditions.

name: Hatzolah Mobile Command Center
description: A vehicle based command center will be a critical part of its response infrastructure in order to help provide top-tier care for all citizens of New York City.

name: Safety & Security Enhancements at Mapelton Library
description: Upgrade and enhance security features at Mapelton Library

name: Safety & Security Enhancements at Midwood Library
description: Upgrade and enhance security features at the newly renovated Midwood Library

name: Security Cameras in Bensonhurst
description: Install 8 police monitored Argus cameras to deter crime in vulnerable public areas.

name: Van for the Auxiliary NYPD Police Squad
description: This van is a crucial addition to the 66 Precinct auxiliary squad. It will allow the team to respond quickly and efficiently to emergency calls.

name: Beautify Midwood
description: Plant 100 trees throughout the Midwood area.

name: Beth Jacob UPK Roof Top Jungle
description: The roof of this building will be turned into a brand new, innovate playground for all children in the UPK program.

name: OHEL
description: Ohel is a premier social services organization throughout the District. This project will supplement funding for a new, state of the art center.

name: Therapuetic Center at Muishkon Division
description: The Mishkon Division services the needs of people with developmental disabilities. This project would develop a brand new therapeutic center.

name: Repair Gym at PS/IS 109
description: Gym floor has water damage and is warped/buckled in areas. This is not a safe condition for the 550+ students who attend the K - 8 School to experience during their indoor physical activity periods.

name: Repair School Yard at PS/IS 109
description: The school yard is currently sinking so to properly serve the 550+ K - 8 students who attend PS/IS 109 the school yard requires repair.

name: Update Cafeteria at THS
description: The equipment in the Cafeteria is old and worn-out due to several water conditions and other issues. Kitchen space needs to be revamped to serve better, more nutritious, food.

name: Upgrade Field and Bathrooms at THS Track
description: 600+ Students & Sports Teams find it difficult to use track due to bumps and holes; and bathrooms are not safe. This also impacts the safety of Charter Elementary School children who use field.

name: Upgrade Field Lockers at THS Campus
description: Upgrade Football Field Lockers to help promote indoor track use and make the field safer for after school learners and sports teams who use our field.

name: Vision Zero/Safe Routes to Schools ' PS 361
description: Add improvements such as raised center medians, widened sidewalks, neckdowns at intersections, to slow traffic and improve safety for 350 students, their families and staff.

name: Vision Zero/New Bus Pads
description: Bus pads are sections of concrete pavement at bus stops. It would be installed to prevent the weight/heat of the bus from softening the asphalt which damages the street & increases need to resurface.
location: Routes on Nostrand Avenue and Kings Highway.

name: Fix Our Streets in Community Board 14
description: The streets within Community Board 14 are crumbling. This impacts the seniors, adults, youth and pets who live and work in this area. We are asking that 1.86 lane miles is repaired.
location: Ave K, Ave J, Nostrand and Ocean Avenues

name: Safety Upgrade for THS Campus
description: Add Security Cameras around the school (especially in dark areas). This will increase the level of safety for over 800 students which will provide youth with a safe place to learn.

name: Upgrade Safety Cameras at Glenwood Houses
description: Increase safety for 2,600+ residents and the neighbors who work in Glenwood Houses by upgrading the existing security system.

name: Vision Zero/Safe Routes to Schools ' PS 208
description: Add improvements such as raised center medians, widened sidewalks, neckdowns at intersections, to slow traffic and improve safety for 440 students, their families and staff.

name: Tech Upgrade at PS 208
description: Add Laptops and Smartboards for 500 Students at PS 208

name: Technology Upgrade for THS Campus
description: Add Laptops, Laptop carts, Smart boards, iPads and Upgrades to computer labs so that we can decrease the digital divide for 800+ High School students.

name: Update THS Campus Auditorium
description: Upgrade Sound equipment, Projector and screen (adding one which comes out of the ceiling). There are 700+ students who are behind the curve using out of date technology in auditorium.

name: Upgrade PA in Gym 3 at THS Campus
description: Upgrade the Public Address System in Gym 3 for the 500+ students, community members and staff who use this gym. Increasing the ability to clearly receive audible data and positively impact safety.

name: Bus Countdown Clocks
description: Real Time Passenger Information at high traffic bus stops in District 47.

name: McDonald Playground - Reconstruction
description: Funds will be used to renovate the children's play area of McDonald Playground

name: Playground Renovation - Scarangella Playground
description: The project will include renovations to the existing playground, spray shower, courts, paths, landscaping and sidewalks.

name: Surf Playground
description: The funds will be used to reconstruct two full basketball courts.

name: Marlboro Houses - Security Improvements
description: Funds will be used to install additional security cameras at Marlboro Houses.

name: Technology in Elementary Schools
description: Technology upgrades in P.S. 212, P.S. 216, P.S. 97 and P.S. 188.

name: Technology in High Schools
description: Technology upgrades in Rachel Carson High School, Brooklyn Studio Secondary School, and Kingsborough Early College School.

name: Technology in Middle Schools
description: Technology upgrades in I.S. 281, I.S. 228, and I.S. 239.
